newsitem.title: USA: NY precious metals seen opening mostly weaker.
newsitem.headline: NY precious metals seen opening mostly weaker.

text.p: COMEX and NYMEX precious metals futures were seen opening mostly lower Tuesday, with spot gold bullion testing the $350 support level overnight and spot silver testing $5.00 on the downside for the first time since mid-February.
Trading in the London interbank bullion market resumed Tuesday, after the Easter holidays, for the first time since last Thursday.
However, further falls in world equity markets this week may yet provide some support for precious metals, traders said.

COMEX June gold, now the active contract with the April contract in delivery, was seen opening unchanged to down 50 cents an ounce from Monday's close at $353.80, after trading a $354.40-352.60 range in overnight ACCESS trade.
In the bullion market, spot gold was quoted $349.50/00 early, compared to the London morning fix Tuesday at $349.85 and the New York close Monday around $350.70/20.
COMEX warehouse gold stocks rose 16,889 ounces Monday to 1,000,125 ounces.
COMEX May silver was seen opening down 3.00 to 4.00 cents from the previous close at $5.070, after a slide on light volumes as funds liquidated long positions was seen Monday.
COMEX silver stocks rose 641,466 ounces Monday to 191,711,478 ounces.
But NYMEX July platinum, which now has more open interest than the April contract, was seen opening unchanged to up 50 cents from the previous close at $372.50.
NYMEX June palladium was seen opening little changed from Monday's close at $148.00 an ounce.
